title: Boston activist Monica Cannon-Grant to plead guilty in federal fraud case
author: Abby Patkin
bullets: Monica Cannon-Grant plans to plead guilty to federal fraud charges, according to a recent court filing in Boston.
Charges include conspiracy, wire fraud, and tax violations related to misuse of nonprofit funds and false mortgage application.
Her trial was scheduled for October 14, 2025, but a change-of-plea hearing is now expected instead.

title: Here’s what we know about Tyler Robinson, Charlie Kirk’s alleged assassin
author: The Associated Press
bullets: Tyler Robinson, 22, from Washington, Utah, is accused of murdering Charlie Kirk at Utah Valley University.
Robinson, a student at Dixie Technical College, was taken into custody without bail; family noted he became more political.
Messages on Discord suggest Robinson acquired a gun; ammunition at the scene had fascism-related engravings.

title: 7 things to know about a pivotal Red Sox-Yankees series
author: Conor Roche
bullets: Red Sox and Yankees begin crucial series at Fenway Park to determine top AL wild-card spot and potential division lead.
Boston leads season series 8-2; Red Sox start Giolito, Bello, and Crochet against Yankees starters Fried, Gil, and Warren.
Red Sox lineup struggles without injured Roman Anthony; Trevor Story steps up, hitting .308 with a .896 OPS in September.

title: Winthrop loses $1.2M in climate grants over MBTA Communities Act noncompliance
author: Annie Jonas
bullets: Winthrop lost $1.2 million in climate grants due to noncompliance with the MBTA Communities Act.
The Executive Office of Energy and Environmental Affairs denied funding for Morton Street and Fisherman’s Bend projects.
Town Council's rejection of zoning proposal led to loss, impacting flood mitigation efforts in vulnerable neighborhoods.

title: Healey orders flags at state buildings flown at half-staff to honor Charlie Kirk
author: Abby Patkin
bullets: Massachusetts flags at state buildings will be at half-staff until Sept. 14 to honor Charlie Kirk.
Charlie Kirk was fatally shot during an event at Utah Valley University; a suspect has been arrested.
Governor Maura Healey and President Donald Trump condemned the assassination and political violence.

title: A family-friendly guide to apple picking in New England
author: Kristi Palma
bullets: Honey Pot Hill Orchards in Stow, Massachusetts, offers over 30 apple varieties, animal feeding, and cider doughnuts.
Cider Hill Farm in Amesbury, Massachusetts, features apple picking, a giant sandbox, trike yard, and live music.
Applecrest Farm Orchards in Hampton Falls, New Hampshire, holds weekend Harvest Festivals with hayrides and themed activities.

title: Judge tosses ordinance limiting tear gas, rubber bullet use by Boston police
author: Abby Patkin
bullets: Judge Jackie Cowin invalidated Boston City Council's ordinance limiting police use of tear gas and rubber bullets.
The ordinance required supervisory approval before using less-lethal measures at protests with more than 10 people.
Cowin ruled the City Council overstepped authority, which is reserved for the Police Commissioner per the City Charter.

title: Did a Brooklyn couple kill a neighbor’s trees for a better view in Maine?
author: New York Times Service
bullets: Stephen Antonson and Kathleen Hackett, Brooklyn residents, are accused of poisoning neighbor Ruth Graham's trees in Rockport, Maine.
Maine's Board of Pesticides Control found trees poisoned with herbicidal chemicals, allegedly to improve Antonson-Hackett's harbor view.
Despite evidence of poisoned trees, Antonson and Hackett, through a lawyer, deny involvement and have not responded to investigators.

title: Pharma giant with large Mass. footprint to slash 9,000 jobs globally
author: Beth Treffeisen
bullets: Novo Nordisk will cut 9,000 jobs globally by end of 2026 to streamline operations.
The company has 450 employees in Massachusetts, with no details on how local jobs will be affected.
Novo Nordisk aims to reinvest savings into diabetes and obesity growth areas, expecting $1.25 billion in annual savings.

title: Police officer, suspect shot in Roxbury during chase
author: Abby Patkin
bullets: A Boston police officer and a suspect were shot during a chase in Roxbury early Friday morning.
The suspect fired first, injuring the officer in the arm; police returned fire, hitting the suspect's legs.
Both individuals were hospitalized with non-life-threatening injuries; a high-capacity firearm was recovered.
